title: Roy's Wedding
description: After Roy's wedding, Jim and Pam wonder if they still have any secrets they're hiding from each other. Meanwhile, Clark tricks Erin into a "news audition," and Dwight challenges Nellie's new charity initiative.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [surveying an untidy office] The building's custodian is on vacation for the month and Dwight is too cheap to hire a replacement. So, instead, we're living in filth. But, not for long. Because I have created the chore wheel.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [viewing the chore wheel for the first time] Oh, yeah! Can I spin first?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Well, it doesn't spin. We'll just move the wheel one notch each morning and... you see what chore you get that day.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: A wheel is supposed to spin.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah, you know, like [motions arm in circles] guh, guh, guh, guh, guh, guh, guh... guh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No, I'm familiar with spinning. It's just that wouldn't work with a chore wheel because people might get the same chore-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [interrupting] Bugh, boring. All she talks about is chores.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: A wheel wants to spin, Pam.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [reluctantly] Spinning would be more fun.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [frustrated] 'Kay.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [spinning a new 'chore wheel' while everyone claps] Okay, that's what I'm talking about! Big money, big money! [wheel stops on 'mug duty', disappointed] Mug duty?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes, you clean all the mugs in the sink.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: This sucks.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah, seriously, it's like everything on there is work.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I don't think you guys understand why we're doing this. It's-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Yeah, I don't think that you understand wheels.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I've been through several rounds of development with the team and here's where we stand with the chore wheel. [introducing a third 'chore wheel', excited] We've got prizes! Ten bucks, candy bar, manager for an hour but, there are also penalties. Like, no internet, Stanley gets your lunch. The one thing that is not on the chore wheel is chores. But they were right; it's more fun this way.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [everyone cheers as Meredith spins and lands on 'tiny wheel'] The tiny wheel actually does have chores. It's so cute no one seems to mind.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [referencing the 'tiny wheel'] Toilets! [everyone cheers as Meredith accepts her chore]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [at the Halpert residence as Cece twirls in the front yard, exiting front door] Pam, we gotta go. Cece, go back inside. Grandma's got breakfast, OK? [to camera] We are going to Roy's wedding. Yep, Roy. I think the only weird thing about going to your wife's ex-fiancé's wedding on a weekday at eight AM is that it's your wife's ex-fiancé.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [exiting house] Thanks, mom!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to Pam] A banana?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah. I'm afraid he's only gonna have hot dogs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Oh, come on. Not even Roy will have hot dogs at his wedding.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Planned a wedding with him. He wanted hot dogs.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [to camera] Just... so weird.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [as Pete and Clark enter office] Oh, Pete, you've got mail.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Really? I got something?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, it's addressed to Customer Service so, it's your mail.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Well, you know, I'm also Customer Service.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah, I'm alternating. [gestures both men]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: [sarcastically] Yay, another person yelling at me.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, it could be a nice letter. I write nice letters to companies all the time.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: That's really nice.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [looking down at Erin's desk] Wow, Newsweek, huh? This election... thing is crazy, right?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: [referring to the letter] It's open.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh yeah, I accidentally read it. It's not a nice letter.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: [whispering] OK.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [distributing paperwork to the office] Get excited. The special projects fairy has arrived.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I know you don't really exist.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Today, I launch my big charity initiative 'Operation Give Back'. Andy has shot down all of my special projects thus far but, this one is about charity. So, I'd like to see him piss on that one.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: [at Roy's wedding] Darryl! Ha-ha! What's happening?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Congratulations, baby!

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Ah, thank you!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [Jim and Pam approaching the wedding venue] Is this his house?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Think so.

quotes.speaker: Server
quotes.text: [approaching Jim and Pam] Mimosa?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [taking glass] Thank you.

quotes.speaker: Server
quotes.text: Would you like me to take your peel?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [embarrassed] Yes, thank you. [finishes banana and hands server the peel]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [as Jim receives and declines a call] Who's that?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh, my ex-fiancé.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [sarcastically] Ha-ha.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I started a new business with my college friend. But, Pam doesn't know. Um... actually I did tell Pam and we decided 'no'. But, then I decided 'yes' anyway. So, I'm thinking there's another conversation coming. And, it's hard to know when that will be.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: With Operation Give Back, you pick the charities Dunder-Mifflin supports.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [grinning] Oh boy! What's happening?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: There's four thousand dollars to give away. So, who has filled out their form? Stanley?

quotes.speaker: Stanley
quotes.text: American Diabetes Association.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Um, you have diabetes, Stanley. [to Nellie] I'm sorry, is the assignment to pick a selfish charity?

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: I w-, uh, I would love to give uh-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [excited] Heifer's International. Listen to this. They give a poor person like, a goat or something. It's a great prank.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: I wanna work with, uh, Jimmy Carter and help build gnomes.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Dwight, what about you?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I will not be participating as there is no evidence that charity works.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, correction, I give to a foundation that teaches homeless children nautical flag signaling. Changes lives.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Thank you, Andy.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I'm not doing it for you. I'm doing it for the preservation of nautical flag signaling.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Dwight, you will be participating.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No thank you.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Participation is mandatory; Dwight, but you can choose whatever cause you like.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Fine, I chose the Global Relief Foundation.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Great, thank you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Which was recently discovered to be a front for the Taliban.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [everyone groans] Oh, for goodness' sake, Dwight.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah. The Taliban in Afa-ghanistan.

quotes.speaker: Creed
quotes.text: The Taliban is the worst. Great heroine, though.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Dwight, I cannot have the Taliban on the roster of Operation Give Back.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Well, it looks like there won't be any Operation Give Back. Ha, ha. The nanny state is over, ladies and gentlemen. You're welcome. [wads up Nellie's charity sheet and tosses it toward her]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [approaches Roy back at the wedding] There he is. Is it almost time to cut the pancake, or what?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Aw, yeah, god, we appreciate everyone coming so early. It's, everyone's just been so nice.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Thanks for inviting us, by the way-

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Are you kidding?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That was, that was a surprise.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Come on. If it wasn't for you, I never would've met Laura. I mean, seriously, kinda dodged a bullet on that one. [sees Jim's reaction] Just kidding.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You're welcome.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Thanks...aw.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: By the way, man, this place is... beautiful.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Started a gravel company. I mean, who knew it'd take off?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Gravel company?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Yeah. What about you? What are you doing?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Not gravel, obviously. [both chuckle] No, things are good. Things are good. Got some stuff in the works. So-

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: Oh, cool.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Yeah, you never know.

quotes.speaker: Kenny
quotes.text: Hey bro, stop wasting time with this haircut. [referring to Jim] He's got a fifty-thousand dollar sports car. Cheers.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: OK, Kenny.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [talking on phone] Duncan, listen, I would love to help you out but where am I gonna find somebody that's pretty, smart and well-informed? Huh? Hold on, hold on. [covers phone's receiver] Erin, do you know anybody that might want... [has realization] Oh my gosh. You love the news, right?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, it depends. I mean, sometimes I find out things that are really sad.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Well, I got a buddy that's a big time local news producer and I can't tell you his name, but it'd blow your mind.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Uh, is it Duncan?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: He's looking for on-air talent and he'd kill me if I didn't get you on tape.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: You mean, put me on the news?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: You'll just come over, put on little lipstick, loosen up with a glass of red wine and then we'll just run through a few stories. You know, a couple different ways, with a couple different outfits. It'd be really tasteful and it'd really help me out with Duncan... with my friend. [Erin considers] What do you say? Huh?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Maybe, ok? Let me think about it.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [Pete looks on disappointed] Ok.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Whoo!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Think it over. [punches Pete]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: No, Clark's not my friend. He is the douche that sits next to me at the office. My friends are Scott, Glenn, and Rob. But, you don't know them.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I never really thought much about being more than a receptionist. But, why? Because I happened to answer help wanted ad to be a receptionist? I mean, what if the ad had been for a CEO? Or for a brain surgeon?

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: So, ah, it was a year ago today that I met Laura. I thought she was my waitress and, uh, took her three weeks to tell me that she actually owned the place. You are full of surprises. You are my beautiful mystery girl. And, today, I have a surprise for you. [approaches piano]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: He plays piano?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: No. Roy? No.

quotes.speaker: Roy
quotes.text: You know how I said I was taking boxing lessons? Actually, I was doing this. Um, so, I hope that you like it. [sits in front of piano]

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: [clapping] You got this, Roy. [Roy begins playing and singing She's Got a Way by Billy Joel, Pam and Jim looked shocked, Phyllis and Bob begin making out]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [in the car] We still surprise each other.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Definitely.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: You know, I never did it, but for your 30th birthday I really wanted to surprise you with-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Courtside seats. Sixers.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. But, what I didn't tell you is that I actually bought the tickets. We only didn't go because it was-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It was an away game.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: In Phoenix. They should really tell you that more specifically. I mean, every game is an away game for one of the teams. [long pause] Do we know everything about each other?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Tell me one thing about you I don't know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [laughs] Um, ok. [thinks but says nothing]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [in the kitchen] Oh, here's one. Did I ever tell you about the time that my brothers videotaped the lottery announcement? And bought the winning numbers the next day? And then, played the tape for me the next week, and I-

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: And you thought you guys were millionaires.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You heard that one.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. But there's, wait, oh, there's a funny ending to that story. I can't remember.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That I thought we were millionaires.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Thought you were millionaires, yeah. That's funny. Shoot, I knew that one.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: That's all right.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: The senator and I still have mystery. I'm always waiting to see what he's gonna surprise me with next. [Oscar chokes on his coffee]

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: You all right? [Oscar nods]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You support the Taliban abroad. So I assume you're willing to live by their rules here.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Anything else would be inconsistent.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Will you join me then in a pledge to live by Taliban law in this office? [offers Dwight a contract]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [takes contract] Absolutely, I will.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: I feared Nellie had some sort of a plan but she used a ridiculous font. Huh. [in a fake English accent] You don't have a plan.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: When you use a ridiculous font, no one thinks you have a plan.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [holds up pen as Dwight searches his desk] Looking for this?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: What the? [follows Nellie into the break room]

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Oh, this is a lovely pen. Ah. But, it's mine now because I stole it.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [taking pen back] Gimme that.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Didn't you sign a contract to live under Taliban law? And now, there's been theft. That means, you're not serious or... someone's getting their hand cut off.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're insane.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I know. So, it's better that you pick another charity.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Oh, and let your precious Operation Power Grab proceed unchecked? No thank you.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: In that case, you... [pulls out a cleaver] will have to chop off my hand.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [considers then takes cleaver] This cleaver appears to need sharpening. I suggest you spend some quality time together just you and your hand. Tie a shoe, toss a salad. Do any of the two hand activities that you'll miss the most.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: I tell you what. I need to make three calls. And then after that, you can become a person who chops off people's hands.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Sounds like a plan.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [in his office] Clark wants to film you in different outfits inside his apartment?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [entering annex] Clark, you and I need to have a little chat. What clothes does Erin need for this news audition?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Uh... couple of button-downs, a camisole, a blazer, a pencil skirt, stilettos, maybe, no, no, not maybe, definitely open-toed. Uh, something low-cut because the camera makes everything seem higher cut.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Really?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yeah, industry secret. You're gonna want some of those panty hose with the seam up the back.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Seems unnecessary for an audition.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: And then, you know, maybe just a robe to wear in between takes but I probably got one she can borrow at my place, so-

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Thank god someone here knows what their talking about. I want you to take this credit card, take Erin to the mall and get that stuff.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: I absolutely will do that.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Awesome. [to Pete] Plop!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Pff. Guess I'll just head over to the mall then. Buy Erin some sexy, fun outfits.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: That Clark, huh? Errr [punches palm] Ca!

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: [in kitchen with several people around] Next question for our oldie-weds-

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: What's the craziest place you've ever made whoopie?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [to Kevin] Language.

quotes.speaker: Phyllis
quotes.text: Who was Pam's first celebrity crush?

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Pam's first celebrity crush.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [whispering] John Stamos.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Ready?

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [as he and Pam flip their cards] John Stamos.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Oh!

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yes. But John Stamos was temporary. I quickly moved on to-

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Johnny Depp.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Johnny Depp. [everyone looks confused toward Toby]

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: [after awkward pause] Sh, uh, um, I was having this separate conversation with Kevin. Uh, Johnny Depp.

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: Totally. George Clooney.

quotes.speaker: Toby
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: OK, I have one. I have one. [Jim's phone rings and he motions he's taking the call elsewhere]

quotes.speaker: Kevin
quotes.text: [while Angela tries asking a question] What is the craziest place you've ever made whoopie?

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: [as Pam wonders about Jim] Kevin, stop it with that question.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [in the stairwell on his phone] Right. And did you show them the market? Yeah. And what'd they say? That's awesome! That, oh my god! Wow!

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: It's not even real yet. And I'm not gonna tell her 'til it's real.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I think maybe there actually is something I don't know about Jim.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Everyone, we have a voluntary meeting in the conference room to discuss Erin's confidence.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Her body. We're gonna talk about her body. [to Darryl] Good. Great job.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Andy made me his consigliere. Which means Assistant Regional Manager. I guess he thought I'd be into The Godfather 'cause I'm black. Wrong! I'm into The Godfather 'cause I'm a cinephile. I like Scarface 'cause I'm black.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to a full conference room] Erin has an audition to be a newscaster. [general acknowledgement]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh-huh. And I want her to feel very comfortable in her very sexy skin. So, everybody say something that you like about her body. All right? Darryl.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: OK, um, I like Erin's hair. It's a very pretty color.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah, right?

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: I'm sorry. This is for a news audition?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Then why are we talking about her looks? Why not her credibility? Or her reliability?

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: News flash everyone. The human race finds attractive people more trustworthy.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: I'm so sorry, Andy, but for twenty years, the most trusted man in America - Walter Cronkite.

quotes.speaker: Meredith
quotes.text: Cronkite was hot. If I could go back in time, I'd take that mustache ride.

quotes.speaker: Oscar
quotes.text: Does Erin have any experience? Has she taken any journalism classes, maybe? Or...

quotes.speaker: Angela
quotes.text: Has she done the pageant circuit?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: No, I watch the news.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: She's gonna be amazing. Look at her. She's gonna light up the screen.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: This is a first for me. And, I don't get a lot of chances, so I have to take them really seriously. I will do whatever it takes to get the job.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [whispering to Pete] Whatever it takes.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: [whispering] Yeah, I know, I heard. I heard.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [places Nellie's hand on a board and holds up cleaver] This is it. Any questions?

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Is it gonna be long?

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No. It's gonna be over before you know it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [pretending to read news] Afghan president Hamid Karzai declared a new policy of dollar days throughout the country. Promising low, low prices on all 2012 Kia Sentras and Sonatas. Aren't you glad you waited? Karzai commented.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Um, where did you get that story?

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: A little bit here, a little bit there. I bet you didn't think I knew current events.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I love it. It's fantastic. Now, tag it with your name.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: For Channel 11 news, I'm Erin Hannon.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pause after 'news'.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: For Channel 11 news... I'm Erin Hannon.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, pause longer.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: That was a good one.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Pause, pause longer. OK? Builds suspense. Don't be shy.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Got it. For Channel 11 news... [very long pause]

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Wha, it's-

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm Erin Hannon.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK. All right. Great. Some great stuff in there.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [as Pam stares at him] I can feel you looking at me.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: OK. Well, here's something you don't know. A couple of weeks ago-

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh-huh.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: I ran into this guy from my high school who has just gotten divorced and he hit on me. In the mall. And I didn't tell you because, I don't know, I felt embarrassed. And, I didn't know if you would be mad or worried. But, anyway, I thought you'd want to know.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: [after a pause] That didn't happen. You would've told me right away.

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: Yeah, I would've. What about you? Come on, there's gotta be something. Between your birth and the last two days, something you just haven't had the chance to tell me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: Uh... [looks at Pam]

quotes.speaker: Pam
quotes.text: [looks knowingly back] Just tell me.

quotes.speaker: Jim
quotes.text: God, give it up, Beesley. You know me too well.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Heh! Ha! [making various sounds and movements while preparing to severe Nellie's hand] [Darryl enters, sees what's happening, and quietly exits]

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Hey, um, I knew something bothered me and I finally figured it out. What news producers are gonna want to see is how Erin relates to the other people on the news team.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: The weird thing is Erin is doing the audition alone.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Oh god.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Now, I'd say Clark could be your co-host... he's already doing camera.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Tuh.

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Someone who's already got rapport with Erin, maybe. I don't know. [Andy smiles at camera]

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Ha! [raises cleaver] This is for real this time.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: It's getting late. I thought you guys could use a little [sets up laptop] inspiration.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: [Darryl hits play] Oh, a movie. What is this?

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: 127 hours. It's about this guy who-

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, no. No spoilers. Please.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: My bad.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No.

quotes.speaker: Darryl
quotes.text: Goodnight.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [answers his door to find Erin, Andy and Pete] Hey! Everybody.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Come in.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right!

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Come on in.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Nice.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: [to Pete] What're you doing here?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Sorry, man. Andy though Erin needed a co-anchor. I'm his makeup guy. My hands are tied.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: [news anchor audition] The victim was released from the hospital with second-degree burns.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [also as anchor] Wow. You know what they say Erin. If you can't take the heat, get out of the kitchen.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Well, he tried to but the fire door was blocked.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: He sure did.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: All right. We got that. That's a rap, everybody.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Aw!

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Just, you sure Clark?

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: Yep, she's done.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: No, I just, I don't mean Erin. I mean for me. I didn't feel good about that.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: No, we got it. We got it.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Great! Let's get some food. I'm starving.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: I don't think we did get it. I could do, uh, a couple more takes. We could do it in close-up. That might even be better for editing.

quotes.speaker: Clark
quotes.text: OK, I don't.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: All right.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: I'm hungry.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: Uh, Pete, you wanna take Erin to get a burger or something?

quotes.speaker: Pete
quotes.text: Yeah, whatever you say, boss.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: OK. [to Erin] I'll call you later.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: OK.

quotes.speaker: Andy
quotes.text: [to Clark] So this is a single.

quotes.speaker: Erin
quotes.text: Hey, even if this doesn't work out for me, I'm just glad I had the guts to do it. And, maybe it'll work out for Andy.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: [as he and Nellie watch the movie] Oh god.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: That is absolutely revolting!

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: He is so good, though.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yes.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: The way he just cuts off his arm.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: If you like James Franco, we really should watch Rise of the Planet of the Apes.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, he's a genius, you know? He was in graduate programs at Yale, Columbia and NYU all at the same time.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Whoopty doo. That doesn't make you a genius.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Well, it doesn't make you stupid.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: Yeah, it does, actually. It makes you real stupid.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Stupid like you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: No, like you.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: Like you.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're the stupid one.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You're the stupid one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You're the stupid one.

quotes.speaker: Nellie
quotes.text: You're the stupid one.

quotes.speaker: Dwight
quotes.text: You, you, you, you...
